item.title: NYT Mini Crossword Hints Today—Answers For Thursday, February 26
item.content:encoded:
The NYT Mini Crossword is a popular, quick-to-complete word game to test yourself daily, but some of the puzzles can be difficult to complete.

If you’ve found yourself stuck on today’s NYT Mini, Insider Gaming has some helpful hints and all the answers for the NYT Mini Crossword on Thursday, 26 February, 2026.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s edition of the NYT Mini Crossword. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How to Play NYT Mini Crossword

The NYT Mini Crossword is available to play on the New York Times Games app or website, but, as of September 2025, a New York Times Game subscription is required.

The NYT Games Subscription is priced at $6.95 per month, but there are introductory offers available for other NYT subscriptions that include games access, which might be worth considering.

Without a Games subscription, access to the NYT Mini Crossword is blocked.

NYT Mini Crossword Clues (Feb. 26)

Here are all the clues provided for the NYT Mini Crossword for February 26, 2026.

Across

1 – Tesla or Toyota

4 – What the “M” of BMX stands for

5 – Leafy lunch

6 – Weighing device

7 – “To be,” in Latin

Down

1 – Pepsi and Coke

2 – Dickens’ “__ of Two Cities”

3 – Took to another floor, as the [circled letters]

4 – Apple computers

5 – Dir. from San Francisco to Santa Monica

Additional Clues For NYT Mini (Feb. 26)

Here are some additional clues to help you solve the NYT Mini Crossword on February 26, 2026.

Across

1 – Driveable vehicle

4 – Racing bike series, __ GP

5 – Vegetarian choice instead of steak

6 – Skin of a reptile, for example

7 – Similar to soul, spirit

Down

1 – 5-letter anagram created from ‘Coals’

2 – Like a story or fable

3 – “I ___ a horse from the stable”

4 – ___ and cheese, plural

5 – Compass direction

All NYT Mini Crossword Answers (Feb. 26)

Here are all the answers for the NYT Mini Crossword on February 26, 2026.

Across

1 – CAR

4 – MOTO

5 – SALAD

6 – SCALE

7 – ESSE

Down

1 – COLAS

2 – ATALE

3 – RODE

4 – MACS

5 – SSE

When is The Next Game?

The NYT Mini Crossword refreshes daily at 10 PM ET on weekdays and Saturdays, and at 6 PM ET on Sundays.

As such, the next NYT Mini Crossword will be available at 7 PM PT/9 PM CT/10 PM ET/3 AM GMT/2 PM AET.

What is The NYT Mini Crossword?

The NYT Mini Crossword was introduced in 2014 as a shorter and quicker-to-complete game to accompany the main New York Times Crossword, which was initially released in 1942.

Until September 2025, the NYT Mini Crossword was free, but it has now been consolidated into a monthly NYT Games Subscription alongside several other popular games.

Did you struggle with the NYT Mini Crossword today? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For your next read, take a look at details of collectibles in LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight, and check out Valve being sued by New York State over loot boxes.

item.title: Today’s Contexto #1257: Hints & Answer For February 26, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Contexto is a word association game that gives you a new word to guess every single day. With every attempt, the AI algorithm determines how close your guess is to the daily answer based on thematic and contextual similarity.

Sometimes, though, no matter how experienced you are, the word you’re looking for can be incredibly vague and hard to deduce. Luckily for you, this guide is full of hints to give you a helping hand, but make sure you give today’s Contexto a go if you haven’t already!

How To Play Contexto

Contexto is incredibly simple to play, but difficult to master. All you have to do is type words into the search bar, and the AI algorithm will tell you how close your word is to the answer.

You’ll know how close your guess is based on the colour of the bar and the number next to it.

  • Red includes guesses with the number 1,501 and above, meaning you’re way off from the secret word.
  • Orange includes guesses between 301 and 1,500, meaning you’re getting closer, but still some ways off.
  • Green includes guesses between 1 and 300, meaning you’re on the right track.

Best Contexto Tips & Tricks

  • Start off using broad terms, then narrow down once you’ve got under the 1,000 mark.
  • Try using Nouns first, and dip into verbs or adjectives once you’ve discovered the context.
  • Experiment with random words at times, especially as different forms of a root word can rank differently, such as work and worker.
  • Guess away, as unlike other word games like Wordle, you aren’t limited to a strict number of attempts.

Best Starting Words For Contexto

Here are some great starting words to get you going with Contexto:

  • Thing
  • Person
  • Place
  • Animal
  • Work
  • Nature
  • Game
  • Concept
  • Idea
  • Food

Contexto Hints For Today, February 26, 2026

Without giving away today’s Contexto answer, here are a few helpful hints to get you thinking in the right direction:

  • Hint 1: Generalising term
  • Hint 2: Refers to plant life
  • Hint 3: Opposite of fauna

If they don’t help, then here are the nine closest words, going from tenth to second:

  • Subtropical
  • Fern
  • Vegetation
  • Tropical
  • Endemic
  • Biota
  • Wildflowers
  • Botanical
  • Fauna

Today’s Contexto Answer For Game #1257 On February 26, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, and still can’t figure out today’s Contexto answer, then you can find it down below:

Answer: Flora

Flora is the plants of a particular region, habitat, or geological period.

When Is The Next Contexto Game After #1257?

Contexto is updated daily at 12 AM or Midnight in your respective time zone, meaning the next game will start on February 27

The Contexto schedule is very consistent, with a new game releasing at the same time every day.

How did you find today’s Contexto? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

item.title: Wolfenstein 3 Casting Call Reveals Early Plot Details
item.content:encoded:
Wolfenstein 3 could finally be in the works.

According to a report from MP1st, a casting call has been uncovered tied to the project. This appears to be our first look at the plot details. The project is codenamed “Valkyrie,” and it is attached to two people who previously worked on several MachineGames titles: performance director Tom Keegan and casting director Emily Schweber. Keegan directed performances for the cast of Indiana Jones and the Great Circle.

Apparent Wolfenstein 3 Plot Details and Production Schedule

Reportedly, the story centers around a character named Sofiya. She’s described as a Ukrainian orphan aged 8 to 11 who forms a bond with William Blazkowicz, the franchise’s main protagonist. The young character is also said to be traumatized by War, making her suspicious, but she’s ultimately labeled a strong survivor.

The casting call also notes that performance capture is scheduled to begin in April, with shooting dates planned for later in 2026 and extending into the next year.

MachineGames had previously stated that they always intended to continue the franchise. Jerk Gustafsson, studio director, said earlier this month that while he wouldn’t comment on a timeline for the third game’s release, they were never finished with the franchise. Read his full comments here.

There’s still no exact confirmation from the studio, but we may be inching closer to finishing the Wolfenstein Trilogy. Insider Gaming will continue to report on the franchise’s future as more information becomes available.

Are you ready for the final game in the Wolfenstein trilogy? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: LEGO Batman Offers 100+ Suits and Other Collectibles
item.content:encoded:
LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight is slated for release later this year, and it’s already promising to honor the multiple eras of everyone’s favorite billionaire playboy-turned-vigilante.

That same attention to honoring the bat’s legacy will also be evident in the gameplay of the upcoming title. TT Games isn’t afraid to say they’re influenced by Rocksteady’s iconic Batman: Arkham series, but they still want to make sure the story focuses on core characters that let the gameplay shine, while also offering the kind of quirky experience only LEGO can provide.

LEGO Batman Promises Collectibles Honoring the Bat’s Decades-Long Legacy

Speaking to IGN at IGN Fan Fest 2026, Jonathan Smith, Head of Development at TT Games, elaborated on the team’s approach to the game’s story, which centers on core characters and promises multiple collectibles, allowing everyone to enjoy a Bat Cave full of memorabilia.

“We then want to give you lots and lots of options to see the full range of what those characters can be by giving you more than a hundred different suits to collect,” he said. “So you still get that moment in the Bat Cave where you’ve got all the different suits from all the different characters arrayed in front of you, colorful and glorious. You’re still compelled to want to complete that collection.”

LEGO Batman Will Be A Game for All Bat Fans

Furthermore, Smith explains why he’s not worried about a game like this alienating traditional fans looking for something more akin to the Arkham series, believing that the LEGO games offer broad appeal across multiple generations of players.

“On the contrary, what we find with all our LEGO games is that the more we can draw upon different aspects of a character, the wider we can make our gameplay, the more appealing it is to us as players, and to younger players and older players,” he answers. “There’s something about Lego that just translates well for everybody. So the more we can put into that, we don’t find that it misses the mark for anyone at all. It just brings more to the party.”

For more LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight, check out the PC specs of the upcoming game. LEGO Batman releases on May 29, 2026. Insider Gaming will continue to provide the latest information surrounding the release.

How excited are you for this game? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
